systemGuideDescription: Below are the main system features and steps on how to use them.

guideContainer.title: Adding and Managing Ingredients
guideContainer.description: In the system, you can easily add, edit, and delete ingredients used to create meals.

steps.title: Add an Ingredient
actions: Go to the 'Ingredients' section in the dashboard.
Click the 'Add Ingredient' button.
Enter the ingredient name and nutritional value.
Note: each ingredient has a default value of 100 g/ml. This makes it easier to calculate the nutritional value for any quantity used in meals.
Click 'Add Ingredient' to save it to the system.

steps.title: Edit an Ingredient
actions: Find the ingredient in the list.
Click 'Edit'.
Update the necessary information.
Save the changes.

steps.title: Delete an Ingredient
actions: Find the ingredient in the list.
Click 'Delete' next to the ingredient.

guideContainer.note: Deleting an ingredient will not remove it from existing meals, so the history will remain unaffected.

guideContainer.title: Creating and Managing Meals
guideContainer.description: Meals are composed of ingredients and can be added to weekly menus.

steps.title: Create a Meal
actions: Go to the 'Meals' section.
Click 'Add Meal'.
Enter the meal name and optionally a description and photo.
Select the meal category.

methods.name: Use AI Search (PRO and PREMIUM members)
actions: Click 'Find Ingredient'.
Enter the ingredient name and click 'Search'.
Enter the required quantity for the meal next to the found ingredient and click the green checkmark.
The ingredient with the specified required quantity will be added to the meal, and the ingredient with 100g/ml nutritional value will be added to your ingredient list.

methods.name: Use Personal Ingredients
actions: Select 'My Personal Ingredients'.
Enter the ingredient name and click 'Search'.
Select the ingredient from the list, enter the required quantity, and click the green checkmark.

methods.name: Add Ingredient Manually
actions: Click 'Add Ingredient Manually'.
Enter the ingredient name, nutritional value, required quantity for the meal, and click 'Add Ingredient'.
The ingredient with the specified required quantity will be added to the meal, and the ingredient with 100g/ml nutritional value will be added to your ingredient list.

steps.title: Save the Meal
actions: Review all the data.
Click 'Add New Meal' to create the meal.

steps.title: Edit or Delete a Meal
actions: Find the meal in the list.
Click 'Edit' or 'Delete'.

guideContainer.note: Deleting a meal will not affect meals already added to weekly menus or orders.

guideContainer.title: Managing Weekly Menus
guideContainer.description: Weekly menus allow you to plan meals and create a weekly eating schedule. Meals added to weekly menus are copied and are independent of the original meal data, so future changes to the meal will not affect previously created menus.

steps.title: Create a Weekly Menu
actions: Go to the 'Weekly Menu' section.
Click the 'Create Menu' button.
Enter the menu name, dietary preferences, and restrictions (if needed).
Click 'Create Menu' to save it.
The successfully created menu will appear in the list, where it can be populated with meals.

steps.title: Add Meals to Weekly Menu
actions: Find the created weekly menu in the list.
Click 'Manage Menu'.
Select the day of the week to which you want to add a meal.
Choose the desired meal from the list and add it to the selected day.
When a meal is added to the weekly menu, it is copied. This means that if the meal is edited or deleted in the 'Meals' section in the future, it will remain unchanged in this weekly menu.
Repeat the steps for each day of the week you want to assign meals to.

steps.title: Manage and Edit Menus
actions: Edit menu information – Click 'Edit Bio' to change its name, dietary preferences, or restrictions.
Copy menu – Click 'Create Copy' to quickly duplicate the weekly menu with all assigned meals.
Archive menu – If the menu is no longer in use, click 'Archive' to free up the limit for new menus.
Unarchive menu – To restore an archived menu, find it using search filters and click 'Unarchive'.

steps.title: Important Notes on Editing Meals and Menus
actions: Once a meal is added to a weekly menu, it becomes an independent copy. This means that if the original meal is edited, it will not reflect in already existing weekly menus.
If you want to update weekly menu meals to the latest versions of meals, you will need to delete the old meals from the weekly menu and add the new versions.
If a weekly menu is already assigned to a weekly plan, it cannot be edited. To make changes, you must first remove the menu from the active weekly plan.

guideContainer.note: Weekly menus allow organizing meals and their schedules, but it is important to note that all meals are copied into the weekly menu. This means that later changes to the main meals will not affect already created weekly menus.

guideContainer.title: Managing Customers
guideContainer.description: In the customer management section, you can add new customers, update their information, assign menus, and remove them from the system.

steps.title: Add a New Customer
actions: Go to the 'Customers' section.
Click the 'Add Customer Manually' button.
Enter the required information to create the customer's profile.
Click 'Add New Customer' to save.

steps.title: Customer Request Form (PRO and PREMIUM members)
actions: Click 'Send Form to Client'.
Enter the client's email address.
Send the form.
Once the client fills out the form, their data will be automatically added to your customer list.
If you want your business name to appear in the emails sent to clients, go to 'Account Settings' > 'Business Information' and update the business name.
If the business name is not provided, your name will be used in the emails.

steps.title: View Customer Information
actions: To find a customer, use the search or browse the customer list.
Find the customer's entry and go to the right side.
Click the three-dot button.
Select 'Customer Information' to view detailed information.

steps.title: Change Customer Status
actions: Find the customer in the list.
Click the three-dot button.
Select 'Change Status'.
If the customer is assigned to an active weekly plan, you will not be able to change their status.

steps.title: Change Customer Menu Quantity
actions: Click the three-dot button next to the customer.
Select 'Change Menu Quantity'.
Specify how many menus the customer can receive.

steps.title: Delete a Customer
actions: Click the three-dot button next to the customer.
Select 'Delete'.
If the customer is assigned to an active weekly plan, they cannot be deleted.

guideContainer.note: To delete a customer, they must not be assigned to an active weekly plan. First, remove the customer from the plan.

guideContainer.title: Managing Weekly Plans
guideContainer.description: The weekly plan links weekly menus to a specific week and assigns them to customers.

steps.title: Create a Weekly Plan
actions: Go to the 'Weekly Plan' section.
Select your time zone to activate the weekly planning feature.
Use the menu bar to navigate between weeks and select the week for which you want to assign weekly menus.
Click 'Assign Menus'.
Select the desired weekly menus from the list.
Click 'Assign Menus' to save the assignment.

steps.title: Assign Customers to Weekly Plan
actions: Find the weekly menu in the list.
Click 'Assigned Customers'.
In the opened window, you will see already assigned customers and the option to add new customers.
Select customers from the list and click 'Assign'.

steps.title: Publish Menus
actions: Once all customers are assigned, the menu must be 'published' to generate orders.
Find the weekly menu in the list and click 'Publish'.
When the weekly menu is published, orders will be generated, including ingredient lists and meal quantities.

steps.title: Manage and Edit Weekly Plans
actions: If you want to edit the weekly plan, you must first 'unpublish' the weekly menu.
To unpublish, click 'Unpublish Menu'.
After unpublishing, you can change the menu or assigned customers.
After making changes, click 'Publish' again.

steps.title: Completing the Weekly Plan (Marking as Done)
actions: When all daily orders are prepared and the weekly plan is completed, you can mark the weekly plan as 'Done'.
Go to the 'Weekly Plan' section and select the current week.
At the top, you will see the 'Mark as Done' button.
Once confirmed, the weekly plan will be marked as 'Completed' and this action cannot be undone.
All orders for this week will automatically be marked as 'Done'.
All weekly menus that are not currently assigned to future weeks will become editable (you will be able to update them).

NOTE: The weekly plan is automatically marked as completed on Monday night according to your time zone, but it can also be manually marked as done at any time (e.g., Friday, Saturday, or Sunday) once the weekly orders are fulfilled.

guideContainer.note: Once the weekly menu is assigned and published, it cannot be edited. If you want to make changes, you must first 'unpublish' the menu. However, if at least one day is marked as 'Ready', the weekly menu cannot be unpublished.

guideContainer.title: ORDERS: General Order List
guideContainer.description: In this section, you can view all weekly orders, see their statuses, and select days for order review or management.

steps.title: View Weekly Orders
actions: Go to the 'Orders' section.
You will see the week's dates and the status of each day's orders.
The active day will be highlighted to easily find the current day.

steps.title: Select a Day's Order
actions: Find the day whose order you want to manage.
Click 'Manage Order'.
The daily order management window will open, showing all necessary information.

guideContainer.note: Days with orders marked as 'Ready' can no longer be edited.

guideContainer.title: ORDERS: Daily Order Management
guideContainer.description: In this section, you can manage specific daily orders, view meal compositions, and assigned customers.

steps.title: View Daily Order
actions: Click the 'Manage Order' button next to the desired day.
At the top of the page, you will see the order date and its status.
To view meals assigned to customers, click 'Orders insight'.
A window will open showing how many portions and which meals each customer should receive.

steps.title: Manage Meals and Ingredients
actions: Select a food category (breakfast, lunch, dinner, etc.) to see related orders.
You will see a list of meals with their statuses and required portion quantities.
Next to each meal, the total ingredient quantity needed to prepare all assigned portions will be displayed.

steps.title: Change Meal Status
actions: When starting to prepare a meal, mark it as 'Preparing'.
When the meal is ready, change its status to 'Done'.
When all meals for the day are prepared, mark the day as 'Done' by clicking 'Mark as Done'.
All meals for that day will be marked as 'Done'.

guideContainer.note: Each day's orders are linked to the weekly menu assignment to the weekly plan. If at least one day is marked as 'Done', the weekly menu cannot be unpublished.

guideContainer.title: ORDERS: Ingredient List Review
guideContainer.description: In this section, suppliers can review the ingredient list for daily orders, add available ingredients, and download the list as a PDF. This helps efficiently prepare for production and ensure all necessary ingredients are available.

steps.title: View Ingredient List
actions: Go to the 'Orders' section.
At the top, click 'Ingredient List'.
Select the day for which you want to review the ingredient list.
Click 'View & Enter Stock'.
You will see the ingredient list with required quantities calculated based on orders.

steps.title: Add Available Ingredients
actions: Select a day or multiple days (using the combination feature).
Review the ingredient list.
If you have certain ingredients in stock, enter their available quantity.
The system will automatically recalculate the missing ingredient quantities based on your input.

steps.title: Download Ingredient List
actions: To download the ingredient list as a PDF, click 'Download PDF'.
The PDF document will include all required ingredients and their quantities for the selected day or combination.

steps.title: Combine Ingredient Lists for Multiple Days
actions: If you want to combine ingredient lists for multiple days, click 'Generate Combined List' in the top menu.
Select the days and click 'Generate Combined List'.
The generated list will appear at the bottom of the page in the 'Combined List' section.
You can also add available ingredients and download the PDF.

guideContainer.note: Suppliers cannot track inventory but can review the ingredient list and add available quantities. The system will automatically calculate missing ingredients to help plan production and ensure smooth supply.

guideContainer.title: Changing Subscription Plan
guideContainer.description: The system allows changing the subscription plan to a higher or lower tier. During the change, access to certain data or features may be restricted.

steps.title: Upgrade Plan
actions: Go to the 'Subscription' section.
Click 'Manage Subscription & Payments'.
Select a new subscription plan.
Confirm the changes and make the payment.
After the upgrade, all new features will be activated immediately.
NOTE: If you cannot see your new plan, try refreshing the page or logging in again.

steps.title: Downgrade Plan
actions: Go to the 'Subscription' section.
Click 'Manage Subscription & Payments'.
Select a new subscription plan.
Confirm the changes and make the payment.
Certain data will be automatically archived if it exceeds the new plan limits.
NOTE: If you cannot see your new plan, try refreshing the page or logging in again.

steps.title: Archived Data When Downgrading
actions: Ingredients and meals exceeding the new plan limits will be archived.
Weekly menus will be archived if they no longer fit into the new plan.
Archived data cannot be actively used but will remain accessible for review if allowed by the plan.

guideContainer.note: When downgrading the plan, data exceeding the new plan limits will be archived. To restore them, you will need to return to a higher plan.

guideContainer.title: Providing Business Information for Invoices
guideContainer.description: To ensure that invoices include correct company or individual business information, users must add their business details to the payment system. This ensures that each issued invoice contains the company name, address, VAT number, and other important details.

steps.title: Log in to the Payment Account
actions: Go to the 'Subscription' section.
Click the 'Manage Subscription & Payments' button.
You will be redirected to the payment management page.

steps.title: Filling in Business Information in the Account
actions: On the payment management page, find the 'Billing Information' section and click 'Update Information'.
Enter the company name or personal name (if using individual business).
Enter the business or residential address.
If applicable, enter the VAT (Value Added Tax) number and business identification number.
Save the changes. This information will automatically appear on all future generated invoices.

steps.title: Important Notes
actions: If the user does not have a VAT number (e.g., operates under an individual business certificate), only standard personal details will be included on the invoice without VAT identification.
Invoices are generated automatically, so it is crucial to ensure that the provided information is accurate and up-to-date.
If no business information is provided, the invoice may only display basic user details (e.g., email).

guideContainer.note: This setting is necessary to ensure that invoices comply with legal requirements. We recommend providing all required information in the payment account in advance.
